ome.smuggler.core.types

Interface MailConfigSource

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DevMailConfigSource, MailConfigReader

    public interface MailConfigSource
    Provides read-only, type-safe access to mail configuration.
    See Also:
    MailConfig

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.nio.file.Path deadMailDir() 
      Email fromAddress() 
      java.net.URI mailServer() 
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> password() 
      MailProtocol protocol() 
      java.util.List<java.time.Duration> retryIntervals() 
      boolean skipServerCertificateValidation() 
      java.util.Optional<Email> sysAdminAddress() 
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> username() 

    • Method Detail

      • fromAddress

        Email fromAddress()
        Returns:
        the "from" address of each and every mail we send.

      • mailServer

        java.net.URI mailServer()
        Returns:
        the host and port of the mail server.

      • protocol

        MailProtocol protocol()
        Returns:
        the protocol to use to communicate with the mail server.

      • skipServerCertificateValidation

        boolean skipServerCertificateValidation()
        Returns:
        whether to skip certificate validation when SMTPS is in use; always returns false if the protocol is not SMTPS.

      • username

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> username()
        Returns:
        the username for logging into the mail server, if configured.

      • password

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> password()
        Returns:
        the password for logging into the mail server, if configured.

      • retryIntervals

        java.util.List<java.time.Duration> retryIntervals()
        Returns:
        intervals at which to retry failed mail relays.

      • deadMailDir

        java.nio.file.Path deadMailDir()
        Returns:
        path to the directory where to keep email messages that could not be relayed to the mail server.

      • sysAdminAddress

        java.util.Optional<Email> sysAdminAddress()
        Returns:
        the email address of the system administrator, if configured or empty otherwise.
